item.title: Helldivers 2: How To Get Premium Warbonds
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Unlock Premium Warbonds in Helldivers 2
  • Warbonds, Explained

The arsenal of weapons in Helldivers 2 is ever-expanding, offering players new ways to deliver democracy throughout the known galaxy. Such weapons are obtained through Warbonds, the game's take on a battle pass-style content delivery system that also comes with new cosmetics, passive boosters, and other goodies.

The Warbond system is very different from the usual style of battle pass that most games come with, though it's not terribly difficult to use or understand. If you're looking to buy the best primary weapons in Helldivers 2 , you may have to purchase Premium Warbonds first. Here's what you need to do to get them.

Updated December 20, 2024 by Marc Santos: The number of Warbonds in Helldivers 2 has been steadily increasing, and not everyone might have the Super Credits needed to purchase all of them. Thankfully, Super Credits are somewhat easy to farm, and for players who have the patience and the dedication to run easy missions for a couple of hours, we've added a quick tip to this guide on how to get Super Credits as quickly as possible.

How To Unlock Premium Warbonds in Helldivers 2

The only way to gain access to the contents of a Premium Warbond is to buy it first. To do this, you'll need 1000 Super Credits , which you can purchase using real money or gather while running missions in Helldivers 2 . You can occasionally find piles of Super Credits on a mission after you open a crashed supply drone, locked container, or two-man-door bunker. Each pile may give either 10 or 20 Super Credits, though there are very rare occasions where players can get 100 Super Credits from a single pile.

Once you have the required amount of credits, go to the Acquisitions page while on your ship by pressing the button indicated at the top of your screen. Then, select the Warbond you want to unlock, then confirm your purchase by holding down the button on the bottom-right side of the screen.

Warbonds, Explained

Warbonds are content drops containing weapons, cosmetics, and boosters that usually revolve around a certain theme. Helldivers 2's Cutting Edge Warbond, for example, contains high-tech energy weapons with matching armor sets, while Democratic Detonation features explosive weapons. Previously, new ones were due to arrive on the second Thursday of every month, but Arrowhead has since decided to focus on quality over quantity by releasing Warbonds less frequently.

So far, the game has only one free Warbond and three Premium ones, though it can be argued that all of them are free as long as players are willing to put in the time to collect enough Super Credits. The good thing about Premium Warbonds is that they don't expire — all of them will be available to everybody at any time, and players don't need to feel pressured about unlocking their contents within a certain amount of time.

All Warbond items are bought using Medals , which are earned by either completing objectives or collecting boxes of Medals from POIs, similar to how Super Credits can be randomly found.

How to Farm Super Credits

With Helldivers 2 receiving new Warbonds every so often, players may find themselves strapped for Super Credits. For players who don't want to spend any more money than they have to, Super Credits can be farmed on missions, and thanks to the many improvements and new content that's been added to the game, farming this currency has become so much easier than when the game first released.

The fastest way to farm Super Credits is to clear a Difficulty 1 mission on a city map . D1 missions are often set in much smaller maps, and if they're in a city biome, players will have an easier time finding POIs that may contain Super Credits thanks to the grid-like city layouts. Equip a jump pack, find a car, or maybe bring a friend or two , then scour the map for crashed pods and other POIs. Once you think you've opened enough, quit out of the mission, then run another one.

item.title: Genshin Impact 5.3 Livestream Redeem Codes (December 2024)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Genshin Impact 5.3 Livestream Redeem Codes (December 2024)
  • How To Redeem Genshin Impact Codes
  • Primogems In Genshin Impact

Primogem is the primary resource Genshin Impact players would need to get new characters and weapons. The easiest way to get this currency is obviously by spending money to buy Genesis Crystals and convert them into Primogems, but the most affordable way is by being active, following every in-game event, and, of course, hunting additional Primogems from web events or codes.

Some redemption codes are released at a fixed interval. For instance, three livestream codes are always announced every six weeks, and new redeem codes are available at the start of every version. If players are wondering which Genshin Impact redeem codes are currently available, they can refer to this article.

Genshin Impact 5.3 Livestream Redeem Codes (December 2024)

Players can redeem the following Genshin 5.3 livestream codes:

  • UAMPGJASECZH - 100 Primogems & 10 Mystic Enhancement Ores
  • LT5NH2TTXUHM - 100 Primogems & 5 Hero's Wits
  • [TBA] - 100 Primogems & 50,000 Mora

Additionally, here are all the Genshin codes for December 2024:

  • FIBE54PL5995 - 10k Mora, 10 Adventurer's Experience, 5 Fine Enhancement Ore, 5 Stir-Fried Fish Noodles, 5 Jueyun Chili Chicken
  • ACUI8BJ5333E - 10k Mora, 10 Adventurer's Experience, 5 Fine Enhancement Ore, 3 Seasoned Fang

  • WAM5UWWU28NV - 60 Primogems & 5 Adventurer's Experience

Expired Codes

  • WTXV36M1J6CO - 10k Mora, 10 Adventurer's Experience, 5 Fine Enhancement Ore, 3 Brilliant Chrysanthemum
  • LA5E77CLZX5V - 60 Primogems & 5 Adventurer's Experience

How To Redeem Genshin Impact Codes

There are several ways players can redeem Genshin Impact codes:

  1. Visit the official website https://genshin.hoyoverse.com/en/gift
  2. Use the redeem codes button from the in-game setting

Method 1

For the first method, visit the official website, then do the following:

  1. Log in to the HoYoverse account that matches the target Genshin account
  2. Select the appropriate server that contains a profile
  3. Paste the code in the Redemption code box, or simply press on the provided link, and this box will be filled automatically
  4. Press redeem

Method 2

For the second method, open Genshin Impact , and once it loads, follow these steps:

  1. Go to Paimon’s menu
  2. Press Settings
  3. Go to Account
  4. Choose Redeem Code
  5. Input the available Genshin Impact redeem code
  6. Press Exchange

Primogems In Genshin Impact

Primogems can be used for several things, but players commonly spend it on wishing banners to get the characters or weapons that they want. Other than this, the currency can also be used to recharge Original Resin or buy Battle Pass level . Each Battle Pass level costs 150 Primogems, and will stay at this rate even if players buy 50 levels at once. Meanwhile, Original Resin recharge gets more expensive over time and is capped at six times per day.

Daily Refill Primogem Cost
1 50
2-3 100
4 150
5-6 200

Each refill will grant 60 Resin, so in total, players can get 360 Resin at the cost of 800 Primogems.

To get Primogems in Genshin Impact , the most reliable and affordable source is the Daily Commission and Welkin subscription. However, other sources like Spiral Abyss, Genesis Crystals, Battle Pass, Events, Adventure Rank rewards, achievements, and HoYoLAB check-in are also available.

item.title: Xbox Series X|S - Thousands of Games to Play Trailer
item.description: Watch this Thousands of Games to Play trailer from Xbox for a look at some of the best games available on Xbox Series X and Xbox Series S.

item.title: Marvel 1943: Rise of Hydra Could Be Making Great Use of Indiana Jones’ Best Trick
item.description:
Marvel Games is ending 2024 with a bang. Despite releasing in an already oversaturated market, Marvel Rivals has managed to amass over 20 million players in the last few weeks, already becoming one of the most successful Marvel video game launches of all time. And to close out the year with a final treat, Marvel 1943: Rise of Hydra has just released a few more details about its story.

Entertainment Weekly has just published an interview with Amy Hennig, creative director and writer for the first three Uncharted games, and producer on Marvel 1943: Rise of Hydra . During the interview, Hennig briefly touches on the game's inspirations, teases its villains, and confirms that players will be heading to Wakanda, and that last little detail might suggest Marvel 1943 is borrowing one of Indiana Jones and the Great Circle 's best qualities.

Marvel 1943: Rise of Hydra Could Be Borrowing Indiana Jones' Globe-Trotting Structure

Indiana Jones and the Great Circle's Varied Settings Are a Huge Highlight

After an hour or so of more linear gameplay, Indiana Jones and the Great Circle drops players into a large open area. Players are then quickly let off-leash, being allowed to roam freely around the open-ended environment, completing side quests, exploring for upgrades and resources, and progressing the game's story via main missions. When players complete the final dungeon/tomb of an area, Indiana Jones and the Great Circle then whisks them off to a new location, and the process begins all over again. This globe-trotting approach comes with three interweaving benefits.

The first benefit of this approach is that it helps to maintain Indiana Jones and the Great Circle 's great pacing. Before players can even think about getting bored with an area's layout, its environmental challenges, or its enemy placement, they're taken to a brand-new location, with a new map to explore and memorize, and new missions and puzzles to complete.

A change of scenery also means that Indiana Jones and the Great Circle offers a great deal of variety in terms of visuals. Each setting has completely distinct architecture and foliage, and the expert use of sound design and lighting gives each area a unique atmosphere. Indiana Jones and the Great Circle 's globe-trotting structure also goes a long way in fueling the player's sense of adventure, which is a vital element to get right in an Indiana Jones video game.

Marvel 1943: Rise of Hydra Might Be Taking a Page Out of Indy's Playbook

In Entertainment Weekly's interview with Amy Hennig, the producer stated that Marvel 1943: Rise of Hydra will be a "globe-trotting story" that taps into the tropes of "classic men-on-a-mission movies." WW2-era Paris was already confirmed to be a primary setting in Marvel 1943 , and now Wakanda is confirmed too. But that's only the beginning, as Hennig states in the recent interview that there are "yet-to-be-revealed locations in between" those two.

Based on these quotes, it seems as though Marvel 1943: Rise of Hydra could carry forward one of Indiana Jones and the Great Circle 's greatest strengths. A globe-trotting structure will hopefully allow Marvel 1943 to maintain a natural pace throughout its story, and keep fans engaged at all times by offering stunning new locations to marvel at.

item.title: Animal Crossing: Pocket Camp Complete - How to Get Complete Tickets
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Where to Find Complete Ticket in Pocket Camp Complete
    • Can You Buy Complete Tickets?
    • Gulliver's Ship
    • Seasonal Events
  • How to Use Complete Ticket in Pocket Camp Complete
    • What Can You Get with Complete Tickets?

In Animal Crossing: Pocket Camp Complete , you may notice clothing or furniture under the Limited or Featured tab in your Craft menu. As the name indicates, you can't obtain these items from your crafting recipes or from the Market Place. Furniture/clothing in Featured will be swapped out every 24 hours while the Limited-Time are related to in-game events, such as Toy Day. If you don't want to wait for exclusive furniture, then you should get Complete Tickets. A Complete Ticket in Pocket Camp Complete can be exchanged for items or cookies in the Complete Item Catalog or Complete Fortune Cookie Catalog.

Where to Find Complete Ticket in Pocket Camp Complete

Can You Buy Complete Tickets?

In Pocket Camp Complete , you can't buy Complete Tickets, and the only way to get a Complete Ticket is through Gulliver's Ship or as a reward for in-game/seasonal events.

Gulliver's Ship

Complete Tickets are sometimes given as Souvenirs from Gulliver's Ship, but you'll notice they aren't available on every island. You can check the Souvenirs Offered menu for each island by tapping their respective gift icon. Islands that are gold usually have x1 Complete Ticket as a Souvenir. If you keep sending out Gulliver's Ship to the island with the Complete Ticket, you'll eventually get it. Unfortunately, you can only open one Souvenir for free. If you want all the souvenirs that Gulliver could find, you'll have to pay with Leaf Tokens (starting price at 12).

Gold islands usually have Blathers's treasure maps that will unlock animals you won't be able to find anywhere else. It's highly recommended you get all the rewards from golden islands before "refreshing" the Gulliver's Ship screen.

Gold islands with the Complete Tickets will 140 points worth of cargo. However, the required cargo for gold islands can only be crafted. You'll need a variety of crafting materials, including Essence, to build one. The quickest way to load the ship is to craft a golden package , which has a max value of 140. The downside is that it requires rare crafting materials and has a longer crafting time:

  • Crafting time: 30 minutes
  • Bells required: 1000
  • x5 Friend Powder
  • x1 HH Powder
  • x1 Sparkle Stone
  • x10 Wood

Seasonal Events

If you've been keeping up with seasonal events, you'll likely earn a few Complete Tickets by partaking in the daily/weekly activities. For example, the Toy Day Fishing Tourney ran from 12/10 to 12/19 at Saltwater Shores . During this event, you could catch exclusive fish which could then be turned in to Jingle to earn points towards your Fishing Tourney score. Selecting the purple fishing rod icon in the upper-left corner of your screen would open a window detailing the Fishing Tourney. Selecting the Goals tab would allow you to collect a variety of rewards per milestone. Among these rewards were Toy-Day-bell ornaments , which you could turn in through your planner to exchange for a possible Complete Ticket.

In short, for any seasonal event , you'll want to select your planner then the seasonal event tab at the bottom of the screen . This takes you to a new page where you can collect rare items.

How to Use Complete Ticket in Pocket Camp Complete

What Can You Get with Complete Tickets?

One thing you'll have to remember with Complete Tickets is that you can only get x1 furniture/clothing/cookie . If you have a Complete Ticket in your inventory, there will be a gold crown sticker on your Craft and Map tabs on your screen:

  • If you want to exchange a Complete Ticket for an item, choose Craft and select Complete Item Catalog at the top of the screen.
  • If you want to exchange a Complete Ticket for a fortune cookie, go to Map, choose Tim and Tommy's icon, and then select Complete Cookie Catalog at the bottom of the screen.

There are over 70 item sets and event fortune cookies. Even if you don't have Complete Tickets, you can browse and see what's available. One difference between the fortune cookie and item catalog is that you can choose the exact furniture/clothing you want in the item catalog. The Fortune Cookie Catalog allows you to choose a fortune cookie from a set, but whatever you end up getting is based on luck and the star rating of the fortune cookie item. There are also no ways to lower the chances of getting the same item a second/third time.

If you'd rather not waste a Complete Ticket on something from the Complete Item Catalog, then keep checking the Featured tab and the Limited-Time tab in your Craft menu. You might be able to craft it using Bells, timed material and crafting materials. Other items in the Limited-Time category can be made on the spot for the cost of Leaf Tokens.
